headline: Toll House® Famous Fudge
description: You can't beat the original. Satisfy your chocolate craving with some Toll House Famous Fudge.
name: Toll House® Famous Fudge
recipeIngredient: 1.5 cups NESTLE® TOLL HOUSE® Semi-Sweet Chocolate Morsels

recipeInstructions.text: COMBINE sugar, evaporated milk, butter and salt in medium, heavy-duty saucepan. Bring to a full rolling boil over medium heat, stirring constantly. Boil, stirring constantly, for 4 to 5 minutes. Remove from heat.

STIR in marshmallows, morsels, nuts and vanilla extract. Stir vigorously for 1 minute or until marshmallows are melted. Pour into prepared baking pan; refrigerate for 2 hours or until firm. Lift from pan; remove foil. Cut into pieces.

review.reviewBody: The best fudge. Very smooth and creamy.
Have made this a few times according to the recipe and will definitely shorten the cooking time as suggested. At 4 minutes it turns out hard and crumbly.
Loved the creamy texture and the rich flavor. Very quick to make and I did add about 1/4 cup extra chocolate. My kids ate the whole pan in no time.
The first batch I made following the recipe exactly. It came out really chewy. I added 1/2 cup more chips and 1 TBS of butter and only boiled 2-3 minutes. It came out perfect.

My husband loves this fudge. He wears dentures and it isn't too hard. He loves the taste a lot! Easy to make too. I've made it for Thanksgiving, Christmas and during the week when his sweet tooth is craving fudge. Make it, it's a keeper!
Very tasty and easy to make.
I made it exactly as the recipe says, except I left out the nuts. It was delicious, and I received many compliments from those who tried it. Thanks!
Love this recipe!
Creamy, smooth, chocolaty, with walnut pieces !! It was the best I’ve had in a long time. Definitely on my Christmas candy list.
I spent hours trying to make fudge over 5 times and only once came close to a good consistency. These take 15 minutes and taste great with an awesome texture. Now to learn to limit my daily intake.
Always buy Tollhouse Semi Sweet Chocolate in the big bag at Costco for the holidays and use many recipes, but never the fudge. Fantastico!
I really like this fudge! It is very simple and tasty. One suggestion is too only boil the evaporated milk mixture for 2-3 minutes. (3 if at altitude)
Great recipe. The only thing I changed was I used dark chocolate chips. Everyone in my house loved it!
The only tweak I make is I add 3 tablespoons butter. Everyone loves it and requests it. It is creamy and just melts in your mouth!

I used 1/2 cup dark chocolate chips, and 1 cup semi-sweet. I cooked for exactly four minutes, starting when it starts to boil. It is flipping fantastic! Honestly, the best fudge I have ever had. Fudge is usually too sweet and not chocolatey enough for me. This is just the ticket, and the texture (once well chilled) is heavenly.

My granddaughter (age 19) and I made this fudge yesterday and it was awful. It is hard as a rock and unfit to give as Christmas gifts as we had intended. I see that other reviews said to boil for 2-3 minutes. Wish we had read that review first. The fudge we made is going in the trash. :(
Added walnuts. Creamy texture, will make again. Soooo easy.
So easy and sooooo good! It took me very little time to make and yet was a huge hit with my family. Definitely making this again.
I followed the instructions exactly and it never hardened. It was more of a fudgy mush squares.
Made exactly as directed. It was perfect. So easy & tasty. I'll never make any other fudge again.
This fudge was so creamy! Fantastic! We are never making our old fudge again. Thank you!

Easy! I took another reviewers suggestion and used marshmallow cream in the sugar/milk mixture. Opted out of the nuts. It's in the fridge right now, but after licking the spoon, I can already tell how delicious it will be.
I think this turned out great! I used half milk chocolate and half semi sweet chocolate chips. Simple and Easy.

I have been making this recipe for years! I sometimes use milk chocolate chips and I also use this recipe with peanut butter chips! This always turns out wonderfully and am asked for the recipe. Thank you.

This recipe came out perfectly. For one batch I substituted 1 1/2 cups semi sweet chips for 1 cup milk and 1/2 cup semi sweet... DELICIOUS. Extremely creamy and my husband says,"Tastes like fudge." Will now make all of the time. It was SO easy
This fudge has a wonderful chocolate taste. If I made it again I would not boil for the 4 - 5 minutes stated in the recipe - it turned out hard. 2 - 3 mintues would make a creamier fudge.

I was looking for a recipe for fudge that was as simple as could be and I found this. It tastes just like those more complicated recipes, who would have guessed you just boil a few ingredients, mix in a few others, and refridgerate. I love this recipe!
Very Very delicious. If you live in the UK, Use castor sugar because granulated sugar is far too coarse and does not give a creamy texture, no matter how long you cook it!
EXCELLENT!
This was my first time at making fudge, and it turned out great. This will be a keeper in my house. You can't mess this recipe up.
This had a really good taste, and was easy to make.

I have used this recipe for years and it always turns out great! I use half milk chocolate chips and half semi-sweet chips and always get rave reviews. Sometimes I even throw in a handful of peanut butter chips for a great chocolate peanut butter fudge! Always creamy and the perfect texture. Thanks Nestle!!!!!

I did not like this recipe at all! I followed the directions to the letter, with poor results. It looks NOTHING like the picture. It wasn't creamy either, and the sugar cooking time needs increased or the sugar will still be "gritty". I will not be making this again!
This is a pretty standard recipe, and was pretty good fudge, but not quite as good as I had hoped.
I use marshmellow cream and melt with the sugar and condensed milk...It makes the fudge really creamy..
